items.title: WBD Officially Agrees To Go With Paramount Skydance In US$110 Billion Deal
items.summary:
Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) has decided to be officially acquired by Paramount Skydance, squashing its original deal to be acquired by Netflix. The deal will cost the latter US$110 billion (~RM428 billion), instead of the US$111 billion (~RM431 billion) that was initially agreed upon. Netflix said it politely declined to match Paramount Skydance’s offer of […]

items.title: Pokémon Day 2026 roundup: All of the most exciting reveals, product releases, and more
items.summary:
Pokémon Day 2026 has been an eventful one. Kicking off with the launch of the new LEGO sets before the 30th anniversary Pokémon Presents officially revealed the new Gen 10 mainline Pokémon Winds and Waves. We then saw the new Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen officially release on Switch and Switch 2 before we made our way over to the official Nintendo Store in NYC to cap off the celebrations in person, and there are still some new pocket monster experiences set for release next month. Head below to dive into all of today’s most exciting announcements, reveals, and releases.

items.title: New Pokémon Game Boy music player announced for 30th anniversary with tracks from original Pokémon Red and Blue games
items.summary:
Update: Nintendo’s new Pokémon Game Boy music player is now up for grabs for $69.99 shipped. More details in the original post below.

As part of the announcements from the 30th anniversary Pokémon Presents for Pokémon Day 2026, Nintendo just teased a jukebox with the shape of a Game Boy. Nintendo really loves teasing fans with Game Boy nostalgia – first the LEGO Game Boy last year, and now this. This Game Boy-inspired jukebox lets you play retro tracks from the original Pokémon Red and Blue. Check out more details below, along with the trailer.

items.summary:
It’s officially February 27, 2026, which means today is a celebration of all things Pokémon! It’s been 30 years since the release of the first-gen Pokémon Red and Blue games that began the entire franchise and became a global phenomenon. Amongst the new game releases, an official pinball machine, and more – LEGO is stirring up quite the buzz as the first of its three new Pokémon sets are hitting shelves, complete with two GWP sets, too. You can get a rundown on these three sets that fans have eagerly been waiting for below.
